content: 1 The word of the LORD that came to Micah the Morashtite, who prophesied concerning Samaria and Jerusalem in the reigns of Kings Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah of Judah.
content_old: 1 The word of the LORD that came to Micah the Morashtite, who prophesied concerning Samaria and Jerusalem in the reigns of Kings Jotham, Ahaz, and Hezekiah of Judah.

content: 2 Listen, all you peoples, Give heed, O earth, and all it holds; And let my Lord GOD be your accuser— My Lord from His holy abode.
content_old: 2 Listen, all you peoples, Give heed, O earth, and all it holds; And let my Lord GOD be your accuser— My Lord from His holy abode.

content: 3 For lo! the LORD Is coming forth from His dwelling-place, He will come down and stride Upon the heights of the earth.
content_old: 3 For lo! the LORD Is coming forth from His dwelling-place, He will come down and stride Upon the heights of the earth.

content: 4 The mountains shall melt under Him And the valleys burst open— Like wax before fire, Like water cascading down a slope.
content_old: 4 The mountains shall melt under Him And the valleys burst open— Like wax before fire, Like water cascading down a slope.

content: 5 All this is for the transgression of Jacob, And for the sins of the House of Israel. What is the transgression of Jacob But Samaria, And what the shrines of Judah But Jerusalem?
content_old: 5 All this is for the transgression of Jacob, And for the sins of the House of Israel. What is the transgression of Jacob But Samaria, And what the shrines of Judah But Jerusalem?

content: 6 So I will turn Samaria Into a ruin in open country, Into ground for planting vineyards; For I will tumble her stones into the valley And lay her foundations bare.
content_old: 6 So I will turn Samaria Into a ruin in open country, Into ground for planting vineyards; For I will tumble her stones into the valley And lay her foundations bare.

content: 7 All her sculptured images shall be smashed, And all her harlot’s wealth be burned, And I will make a waste heap of all her idols, For they were amassed from fees for harlotry, And they shall become harlots’ fees again.
content_old: 7 All her sculptured images shall be smashed, And all her harlot’s wealth be burned, And I will make a waste heap of all her idols, For they were amassed from fees for harlotry, And they shall become harlots’ fees again.

content: 8 Because of this I will lament and wail; I will go stripped and naked! I will lament as sadly as the jackals, As mournfully as the ostriches.
content_old: 8 Because of this I will lament and wail; I will go stripped and naked! I will lament as sadly as the jackals, As mournfully as the ostriches.

content: 9 For her wound is incurable, It has reached Judah, It has spread to the gate of my people, To Jerusalem.
content_old: 9 For her wound is incurable, It has reached Judah, It has spread to the gate of my people, To Jerusalem.

content: 10 Tell it not in Gath, Refrain from weeping; In Beth-leaphrah, Strew dust over your head.
content_old: 10 Tell it not in Gath, Refrain from weeping; In Beth-leaphrah, Strew dust over your head.

content: 11 Pass on, inhabitants of Shaphir! Did not the inhabitants of Zaanan Have to go forth naked in shame? There is lamentation in Beth-ezel— It will withdraw its support from you.
content_old: 11 Pass on, inhabitants of Shaphir! Did not the inhabitants of Zaanan Have to go forth naked in shame? There is lamentation in Beth-ezel— It will withdraw its support from you.

content: 12 Though the inhabitants of Maroth Hoped for good, Yet disaster from the LORD descended Upon the gate of Jerusalem.
content_old: 12 Though the inhabitants of Maroth Hoped for good, Yet disaster from the LORD descended Upon the gate of Jerusalem.

content: 13 Hitch the steeds to the chariot, Inhabitant of Lachish! It is the beginning Of Fair Zion’s guilt; Israel’s transgressions Can be traced to you!
content_old: 13 Hitch the steeds to the chariot, Inhabitant of Lachish! It is the beginning Of Fair Zion’s guilt; Israel’s transgressions Can be traced to you!

content: 14 Truly, you must give a farewell gift To Moresheth-gath. The houses of Achzib are To the kings of Israel Like a spring that fails.
content_old: 14 Truly, you must give a farewell gift To Moresheth-gath. The houses of Achzib are To the kings of Israel Like a spring that fails.

content: 15 A dispossessor will I bring to you Who dwell in Mareshah; At Adullam the glory Of Israel shall set.
content_old: 15 A dispossessor will I bring to you Who dwell in Mareshah; At Adullam the glory Of Israel shall set.

content: 1 Ah, those who plan iniquity And design evil on their beds; When morning dawns, they do it, For they have the power.
content_old: 1 Ah, those who plan iniquity And design evil on their beds; When morning dawns, they do it, For they have the power.

content: 2 They covet fields, and seize them; Houses, and take them away. They defraud men of their homes, And people of their land.
content_old: 2 They covet fields, and seize them; Houses, and take them away. They defraud men of their homes, And people of their land.

content: 3 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I am planning such a misfortune against this clan that you will not be able to free your necks from it. You will not be able to walk erect; it will be such a time of disaster.
content_old: 3 Assuredly, thus said the LORD: I am planning such a misfortune against this clan that you will not be able to free your necks from it. You will not be able to walk erect; it will be such a time of disaster.

content: 4 In that day, One shall recite a poem about you, And utter a bitter lament, And shall say: “My people’s portion changes hands; How it slips away from me! Our field is allotted to a rebel. We are utterly ravaged.”
content_old: 4 In that day, One shall recite a poem about you, And utter a bitter lament, And shall say: “My people’s portion changes hands; How it slips away from me! Our field is allotted to a rebel. We are utterly ravaged.”

content: 5 Truly, none of you Shall cast a lot cord In the assembly of the LORD!
content_old: 5 Truly, none of you Shall cast a lot cord In the assembly of the LORD!

content: 6 “Stop preaching!” they preach. “That’s no way to preach; Shame shall not overtake us.
content_old: 6 “Stop preaching!” they preach. “That’s no way to preach; Shame shall not overtake us.

content: 7 Is the House of Jacob condemned? Is the LORD’s patience short? Is such His practice?” To be sure, My words are friendly To those who walk in rectitude;
content_old: 7 Is the House of Jacob condemned? Is the LORD’s patience short? Is such His practice?” To be sure, My words are friendly To those who walk in rectitude;

content: 8 But an enemy arises against My people. You strip the mantle with the cloak Off such as pass unsuspecting, Who are turned away from war.
content_old: 8 But an enemy arises against My people. You strip the mantle with the cloak Off such as pass unsuspecting, Who are turned away from war.

content: 9 You drive the women of My people away From their pleasant homes; You deprive their infants Of My glory forever.
content_old: 9 You drive the women of My people away From their pleasant homes; You deprive their infants Of My glory forever.

content: 10 Up and depart! This is no resting place Because of your defilement. Terrible destruction shall befall.
content_old: 10 Up and depart! This is no resting place Because of your defilement. Terrible destruction shall befall.

content: 11 If a man were to go about uttering Windy, baseless falsehoods: “I’ll preach to you in favor of wine and liquor”— He would be a preacher acceptable to that people.
content_old: 11 If a man were to go about uttering Windy, baseless falsehoods: “I’ll preach to you in favor of wine and liquor”— He would be a preacher acceptable to that people.

content: 12 I will assemble Jacob, all of you; I will bring together the remnant of Israel; I will make them all like sheep of Bozrah, Like a flock inside its pen— They will be noisy with people.
content_old: 12 I will assemble Jacob, all of you; I will bring together the remnant of Israel; I will make them all like sheep of Bozrah, Like a flock inside its pen— They will be noisy with people.

content: 1 I said: Listen, you rulers of Jacob, You chiefs of the House of Israel! For you ought to know what is right,
content_old: 1 I said: Listen, you rulers of Jacob, You chiefs of the House of Israel! For you ought to know what is right,

content: 2 But you hate good and love evil.
content_old: 2 But you hate good and love evil.

content: 3 You have devoured My people’s flesh; You have flayed the skin off them, And their flesh off their bones. And after tearing their skins off them, And their flesh off their bones, And breaking their bones to bits, You have cut it up as into a pot, Like meat in a caldron.
content_old: 3 You have devoured My people’s flesh; You have flayed the skin off them, And their flesh off their bones. And after tearing their skins off them, And their flesh off their bones, And breaking their bones to bits, You have cut it up as into a pot, Like meat in a caldron.

content: 4 Someday they shall cry out to the LORD, But He will not answer them; At that time He will hide His face from them, In accordance with the wrongs they have done.
content_old: 4 Someday they shall cry out to the LORD, But He will not answer them; At that time He will hide His face from them, In accordance with the wrongs they have done.

content: 5 Thus said the LORD to the prophets Who lead My people astray, Who cry “Peace!” When they have something to chew, But launch a war on him Who fails to fill their mouths:
content_old: 5 Thus said the LORD to the prophets Who lead My people astray, Who cry “Peace!” When they have something to chew, But launch a war on him Who fails to fill their mouths:

content: 6 Assuredly, It shall be night for you So that you cannot prophesy, And it shall be dark for you So that you cannot divine; The sun shall set on the prophets, And the day shall be darkened for them.
content_old: 6 Assuredly, It shall be night for you So that you cannot prophesy, And it shall be dark for you So that you cannot divine; The sun shall set on the prophets, And the day shall be darkened for them.

content: 7 The seers shall be shamed And the diviners confounded; They shall cover their upper lips, Because no response comes from God.
content_old: 7 The seers shall be shamed And the diviners confounded; They shall cover their upper lips, Because no response comes from God.

content: 8 But I, I am filled with strength by the spirit of the LORD, And with judgment and courage, To declare to Jacob his transgressions And to Israel his sin.
content_old: 8 But I, I am filled with strength by the spirit of the LORD, And with judgment and courage, To declare to Jacob his transgressions And to Israel his sin.

content: 9 Hear this, you rulers of the House of Jacob, You chiefs of the House of Israel, Who detest justice And make crooked all that is straight,
content_old: 9 Hear this, you rulers of the House of Jacob, You chiefs of the House of Israel, Who detest justice And make crooked all that is straight,

content: 10 Who build Zion with crime, Jerusalem with iniquity!
content_old: 10 Who build Zion with crime, Jerusalem with iniquity!

content: 11 Her rulers judge for gifts, Her priests give rulings for a fee, And her prophets divine for pay; Yet they rely upon the LORD, saying, “The LORD is in our midst; No calamity shall overtake us.”
content_old: 11 Her rulers judge for gifts, Her priests give rulings for a fee, And her prophets divine for pay; Yet they rely upon the LORD, saying, “The LORD is in our midst; No calamity shall overtake us.”

content: 1 In the days to come, The Mount of the LORD’s House shall stand Firm above the mountains; And it shall tower above the hills. The peoples shall gaze on it with joy,
content_old: 1 In the days to come, The Mount of the LORD’s House shall stand Firm above the mountains; And it shall tower above the hills. The peoples shall gaze on it with joy,

content: 2 And the many nations shall go and shall say: “Come, Let us go up to the Mount of the LORD, To the House of the God of Jacob; That He may instruct us in His ways, And that we may walk in His paths.” For instruction shall come forth from Zion, The word of the LORD from Jerusalem.
content_old: 2 And the many nations shall go and shall say: “Come, Let us go up to the Mount of the LORD, To the House of the God of Jacob; That He may instruct us in His ways, And that we may walk in His paths.” For instruction shall come forth from Zion, The word of the LORD from Jerusalem.

content: 3 Thus He will judge among the many peoples, And arbitrate for the multitude of nations, However distant; And they shall beat their swords into plowshares And their spears into pruning hooks. Nation shall not take up Sword against nation; They shall never again know war;
content_old: 3 Thus He will judge among the many peoples, And arbitrate for the multitude of nations, However distant; And they shall beat their swords into plowshares And their spears into pruning hooks. Nation shall not take up Sword against nation; They shall never again know war;

content: 4 But every man shall sit Under his grapevine or fig tree With no one to disturb him. For it was the LORD of Hosts who spoke.
content_old: 4 But every man shall sit Under his grapevine or fig tree With no one to disturb him. For it was the LORD of Hosts who spoke.

content: 5 Though all the peoples walk Each in the names of its gods, We will walk In the name of the LORD our God Forever and ever.
content_old: 5 Though all the peoples walk Each in the names of its gods, We will walk In the name of the LORD our God Forever and ever.

content: 6 In that day —declares the LORD— I will assemble the lame sheep And will gather the outcast And those I have treated harshly;
content_old: 6 In that day —declares the LORD— I will assemble the lame sheep And will gather the outcast And those I have treated harshly;

content: 7 And I will turn the lame into a remnant And the expelled into a populous nation. And the LORD will reign over them on Mount Zion Now and for evermore.
content_old: 7 And I will turn the lame into a remnant And the expelled into a populous nation. And the LORD will reign over them on Mount Zion Now and for evermore.

content: 8 And you, O Migdal-eder, Outpost of Fair Zion, It shall come to you: The former monarchy shall return— The kingship of Fair Jerusalem.
content_old: 8 And you, O Migdal-eder, Outpost of Fair Zion, It shall come to you: The former monarchy shall return— The kingship of Fair Jerusalem.

content: 9 Now why do you utter such cries? Is there no king in you, Have your advisors perished, That you have been seized by writhing Like a woman in travail?
content_old: 9 Now why do you utter such cries? Is there no king in you, Have your advisors perished, That you have been seized by writhing Like a woman in travail?

content: 10 Writhe and scream, Fair Zion, Like a woman in travail! For now you must leave the city And dwell in the country— And you will reach Babylon. There you shall be saved, There the LORD will redeem you From the hands of your foes.
content_old: 10 Writhe and scream, Fair Zion, Like a woman in travail! For now you must leave the city And dwell in the country— And you will reach Babylon. There you shall be saved, There the LORD will redeem you From the hands of your foes.

content: 11 Indeed, many nations Have assembled against you Who think, “Let our eye Obscenely gaze on Zion.”
content_old: 11 Indeed, many nations Have assembled against you Who think, “Let our eye Obscenely gaze on Zion.”

content: 12 But they do not know The design of the LORD, They do not divine His intent: He has gathered them Like cut grain to the threshing floor.
content_old: 12 But they do not know The design of the LORD, They do not divine His intent: He has gathered them Like cut grain to the threshing floor.

content: 13 Up and thresh, Fair Zion! For I will give you horns of iron And provide you with hoofs of bronze, And you will crush the many peoples. You will devote their riches to the LORD, Their wealth to the Lord of all the earth.
content_old: 13 Up and thresh, Fair Zion! For I will give you horns of iron And provide you with hoofs of bronze, And you will crush the many peoples. You will devote their riches to the LORD, Their wealth to the Lord of all the earth.

content: 1 And you, O Bethlehem of Ephrath, Least among the clans of Judah, From you one shall come forth To rule Israel for Me— One whose origin is from of old, From ancient times.
content_old: 1 And you, O Bethlehem of Ephrath, Least among the clans of Judah, From you one shall come forth To rule Israel for Me— One whose origin is from of old, From ancient times.

content: 2 Truly, He will leave them helpless Until she who is to bear has borne; Then the rest of his countrymen Shall return to the children of Israel.
content_old: 2 Truly, He will leave them helpless Until she who is to bear has borne; Then the rest of his countrymen Shall return to the children of Israel.

content: 3 He shall stand and shepherd By the might of the LORD, By the power of the name Of the LORD his God, And they shall dwell secure . For lo, he shall wax great To the ends of the earth;
content_old: 3 He shall stand and shepherd By the might of the LORD, By the power of the name Of the LORD his God, And they shall dwell secure . For lo, he shall wax great To the ends of the earth;

content: 4 And that shall afford safety. Should Assyria invade our land And tread upon our fortresses, We will set up over it seven shepherds, Eight princes of men,
content_old: 4 And that shall afford safety. Should Assyria invade our land And tread upon our fortresses, We will set up over it seven shepherds, Eight princes of men,

content: 5 Who will shepherd Assyria’s land with swords, The land of Nimrod in its gates. Thus he will deliver us From Assyria, should it invade our land, And should it trample our country.
content_old: 5 Who will shepherd Assyria’s land with swords, The land of Nimrod in its gates. Thus he will deliver us From Assyria, should it invade our land, And should it trample our country.

content: 6 The remnant of Jacob shall be, In the midst of the many peoples, Like dew from the LORD, Like droplets on grass— Which do not look to any man Nor place their hope in mortals.
content_old: 6 The remnant of Jacob shall be, In the midst of the many peoples, Like dew from the LORD, Like droplets on grass— Which do not look to any man Nor place their hope in mortals.

content: 7 The remnant of Jacob Shall be among the nations, In the midst of the many peoples, Like a lion among beasts of the wild, Like a fierce lion among flocks of sheep, Which tramples wherever it goes And rends, with none to deliver.
content_old: 7 The remnant of Jacob Shall be among the nations, In the midst of the many peoples, Like a lion among beasts of the wild, Like a fierce lion among flocks of sheep, Which tramples wherever it goes And rends, with none to deliver.

content: 8 Your hand shall prevail over your foes, And all your enemies shall be cut down!
content_old: 8 Your hand shall prevail over your foes, And all your enemies shall be cut down!

content: 9 In that day —declares the LORD— I will destroy the horses in your midst And wreck your chariots.
content_old: 9 In that day —declares the LORD— I will destroy the horses in your midst And wreck your chariots.

content: 10 I will destroy the cities of your land And demolish all your fortresses.
content_old: 10 I will destroy the cities of your land And demolish all your fortresses.

content: 11 I will destroy the sorcery you practice, And you shall have no more soothsayers.
content_old: 11 I will destroy the sorcery you practice, And you shall have no more soothsayers.

content: 12 I will destroy your idols And the sacred pillars in your midst; And no more shall you bow down To the work of your hands.
content_old: 12 I will destroy your idols And the sacred pillars in your midst; And no more shall you bow down To the work of your hands.

content: 13 I will tear down the sacred posts in your midst And destroy your cities.
content_old: 13 I will tear down the sacred posts in your midst And destroy your cities.

content: 1 Hear what the LORD is saying: Come, present My case before the mountains, And let the hills hear you pleading.
content_old: 1 Hear what the LORD is saying: Come, present My case before the mountains, And let the hills hear you pleading.

content: 2 Hear, you mountains, the case of the LORD— You firm foundations of the earth! For the LORD has a case against His people, He has a suit against Israel.
content_old: 2 Hear, you mountains, the case of the LORD— You firm foundations of the earth! For the LORD has a case against His people, He has a suit against Israel.

content: 3 “My people! What wrong have I done you? What hardship have I caused you? Testify against Me.
content_old: 3 “My people! What wrong have I done you? What hardship have I caused you? Testify against Me.

content: 4 In fact, I brought you up from the land of Egypt, I redeemed you from the house of bondage, And I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.
content_old: 4 In fact, I brought you up from the land of Egypt, I redeemed you from the house of bondage, And I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

content: 5 “My people, Remember what Balak king of Moab Plotted against you, And how Balaam son of Beor Responded to him. Recall your passage From Shittim to Gilgal— And you will recognize The gracious acts of the LORD.”
content_old: 5 “My people, Remember what Balak king of Moab Plotted against you, And how Balaam son of Beor Responded to him. Recall your passage From Shittim to Gilgal— And you will recognize The gracious acts of the LORD.”

content: 6 With what shall I approach the LORD, Do homage to God on high? Shall I approach Him with burnt offerings, With calves a year old?
content_old: 6 With what shall I approach the LORD, Do homage to God on high? Shall I approach Him with burnt offerings, With calves a year old?

content: 7 Would the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams, With myriads of streams of oil? Shall I give my first-born for my transgression, The fruit of my body for my sins?
content_old: 7 Would the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams, With myriads of streams of oil? Shall I give my first-born for my transgression, The fruit of my body for my sins?

content: 8 “He has told you, O man, what is good, And what the LORD requires of you: Only to do justice And to love goodness, And to walk modestly with your God;
content_old: 8 “He has told you, O man, what is good, And what the LORD requires of you: Only to do justice And to love goodness, And to walk modestly with your God;

content: 9 Then will your name achieve wisdom.” Hark! The LORD Summons the city: Hear, O scepter; For who can direct her
content_old: 9 Then will your name achieve wisdom.” Hark! The LORD Summons the city: Hear, O scepter; For who can direct her

content: 10 but you? Will I overlook, in the wicked man’s house, The granaries of wickedness And the accursed short ephah?
content_old: 10 but you? Will I overlook, in the wicked man’s house, The granaries of wickedness And the accursed short ephah?

content: 11 Shall he be acquitted despite wicked balances And a bag of fraudulent weights?—
content_old: 11 Shall he be acquitted despite wicked balances And a bag of fraudulent weights?—

content: 12 Whose rich men are full of lawlessness, And whose inhabitants speak treachery, With tongues of deceit in their mouths.
content_old: 12 Whose rich men are full of lawlessness, And whose inhabitants speak treachery, With tongues of deceit in their mouths.

content: 13 I, in turn, have beaten you sore, Have stunned you for your sins:
content_old: 13 I, in turn, have beaten you sore, Have stunned you for your sins:

content: 14 You have been eating without getting your fill, And there is a gnawing at your vitals; You have been conceiving without bearing young, And what you bore I would deliver to the sword.
content_old: 14 You have been eating without getting your fill, And there is a gnawing at your vitals; You have been conceiving without bearing young, And what you bore I would deliver to the sword.

content: 15 You have been sowing, but have nothing to reap; You have trod olives, but have no oil for rubbing, And grapes but have no wine to drink.
content_old: 15 You have been sowing, but have nothing to reap; You have trod olives, but have no oil for rubbing, And grapes but have no wine to drink.

content: 1 Woe is me! I am become like leavings of a fig harvest, Like gleanings when the vintage is over, There is not a cluster to eat, Not a ripe fig I could desire.
content_old: 1 Woe is me! I am become like leavings of a fig harvest, Like gleanings when the vintage is over, There is not a cluster to eat, Not a ripe fig I could desire.

content: 2 The pious are vanished from the land, None upright are left among men; All lie in wait to commit crimes, One traps the other in his net.
content_old: 2 The pious are vanished from the land, None upright are left among men; All lie in wait to commit crimes, One traps the other in his net.

content: 3 They are eager to do evil: The magistrate makes demands, And the judge judges for a fee; The rich man makes his crooked plea, And they grant it.
content_old: 3 They are eager to do evil: The magistrate makes demands, And the judge judges for a fee; The rich man makes his crooked plea, And they grant it.

content: 4 The best of them is like a prickly shrub; The most upright, worse than a barrier of thorns. On the day you waited for, your doom has come— Now their confusion shall come to pass.
content_old: 4 The best of them is like a prickly shrub; The most upright, worse than a barrier of thorns. On the day you waited for, your doom has come— Now their confusion shall come to pass.

content: 5 Trust no friend, Rely on no intimate; Be guarded in speech With her who lies in your bosom.
content_old: 5 Trust no friend, Rely on no intimate; Be guarded in speech With her who lies in your bosom.

content: 6 For son spurns father, Daughter rises up against mother, Daughter-in-law against mother-in-law— A man’s own household Are his enemies.
content_old: 6 For son spurns father, Daughter rises up against mother, Daughter-in-law against mother-in-law— A man’s own household Are his enemies.

content: 7 Yet I will look to the LORD, I will wait for the God who saves me, My God will hear me.
content_old: 7 Yet I will look to the LORD, I will wait for the God who saves me, My God will hear me.

content: 8 Do not rejoice over me, O my enemy! Though I have fallen, I rise again; Though I sit in darkness, the LORD is my light.
content_old: 8 Do not rejoice over me, O my enemy! Though I have fallen, I rise again; Though I sit in darkness, the LORD is my light.

content: 9 I must bear the anger of the LORD, Since I have sinned against Him, Until He champions my cause And upholds my claim. He will let me out into the light; I will enjoy vindication by Him.
content_old: 9 I must bear the anger of the LORD, Since I have sinned against Him, Until He champions my cause And upholds my claim. He will let me out into the light; I will enjoy vindication by Him.

content: 10 When my enemy sees it, She shall be covered with shame, She who taunts me with “Where is He, The LORD your God?” My eyes shall behold her downfall; Lo, she shall be for trampling Like mud in the streets.
content_old: 10 When my enemy sees it, She shall be covered with shame, She who taunts me with “Where is He, The LORD your God?” My eyes shall behold her downfall; Lo, she shall be for trampling Like mud in the streets.

content: 11 A day for mending your walls— That is a far-off day.
content_old: 11 A day for mending your walls— That is a far-off day.

content: 12 This is rather a day when to you Tramplers will come streaming From Assyria and the towns of Egypt— From every land from Egypt to the Euphrates, From sea to sea and from mountain to mountain—
content_old: 12 This is rather a day when to you Tramplers will come streaming From Assyria and the towns of Egypt— From every land from Egypt to the Euphrates, From sea to sea and from mountain to mountain—

content: 13 And your land shall become a desolation— Because of those who dwell in it— As the fruit of their misdeeds.
content_old: 13 And your land shall become a desolation— Because of those who dwell in it— As the fruit of their misdeeds.

content: 14 Oh, shepherd Your people with Your staff, Your very own flock. May they who dwell isolated In a woodland surrounded by farmland Graze Bashan and Gilead As in olden days.
content_old: 14 Oh, shepherd Your people with Your staff, Your very own flock. May they who dwell isolated In a woodland surrounded by farmland Graze Bashan and Gilead As in olden days.

content: 15 I will show him wondrous deeds As in the days when You sallied forth from the land of Egypt.
content_old: 15 I will show him wondrous deeds As in the days when You sallied forth from the land of Egypt.

content: 16 Let nations behold and be ashamed Despite all their might; Let them put hand to mouth; Let their ears be deafened!
content_old: 16 Let nations behold and be ashamed Despite all their might; Let them put hand to mouth; Let their ears be deafened!

content: 17 Let them lick dust like snakes, Like crawling things on the ground! Let them come trembling out of their strongholds To the LORD our God; Let them fear and dread You!
content_old: 17 Let them lick dust like snakes, Like crawling things on the ground! Let them come trembling out of their strongholds To the LORD our God; Let them fear and dread You!

content: 18 Who is a God like You, Forgiving iniquity And remitting transgression; Who has not maintained His wrath forever Against the remnant of His own people, Because He loves graciousness!
content_old: 18 Who is a God like You, Forgiving iniquity And remitting transgression; Who has not maintained His wrath forever Against the remnant of His own people, Because He loves graciousness!

content: 19 He will take us back in love; He will cover up our iniquities, You will hurl all our sins Into the depths of the sea.
content_old: 19 He will take us back in love; He will cover up our iniquities, You will hurl all our sins Into the depths of the sea.
